title: Multi-Modal Reasoning with Large Language Models: A Survey and Benchmark
venue: IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence
abstract: We present a comprehensive survey of multi-modal reasoning methods and introduce a new benchmark for evaluating reasoning capabilities across text, image, and video.

title: Active Evaluation of Vision-Language Models: When to Ask for Human Feedback
abstract: We propose an active evaluation framework that selectively queries human feedback to reduce cost while maintaining reliable assessment of VLM outputs.

title: Method and System for Adaptive Multi-Modal Query Processing
abstract: Patent application for an adaptive system that routes user queries to the most appropriate modality (text, image, or hybrid) based on context and confidence.

title: Lightweight Reasoning Heads for Efficient Deployment of LLMs
abstract: We introduce small reasoning heads that can be attached to frozen base LLMs to improve step-by-step reasoning with minimal parameter overhead.

title: Preliminary Results: User Study on Explainable AI in Clinical Decision Support
abstract: Poster summarizing early findings from a user study on how clinicians interact with explanations from AI-assisted diagnosis systems.

title: Benchmarking Uncertainty Estimation in Natural Language Generation
abstract: We compare existing methods for uncertainty estimation in NLG and release a benchmark suite for future work.
